{"id":1089753334,"question_id":3171,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"7 months, 1 week","timestamp":1698914746,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/1089753334/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Equal Sum of Two Arrays After Replacing Zeros","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public long minSum(int[] nums1, int[] nums2) {\n        int len1 = nums1.length;\n        int len2 = nums2.length;\n        \n        int sum1=0, sum2=0;\n        int z1=0, z2=0;\n        for(int n : nums1){\n            sum1+=n;\n            if(n==0){\n                z1++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        for(int n : nums2){\n            sum2+=n;\n            if(n==0){\n                z2++;\n            }\n        }\n        \n        \n        if(sum1<sum2 && z1==0) return -1;\n        if(sum2<sum1 && z2==0) return -1;\n        if(sum1==sum2 && z1==0 && z2==0) return sum1;\n        \n        \n        if(sum1<sum2 && sum2-sum1<z1) return -1;\n        if(sum2<sum1 && sum1-sum2<z2) return -1;\n        \n        \n        return Math.max(sum1+z1, sum2+z2);\n            \n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-equal-sum-of-two-arrays-after-replacing-zeros","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
